newsitem.title: PERU: Peru tax revenues up 13.8 pct in Aug vs yr ago.
newsitem.headline: Peru tax revenues up 13.8 pct in Aug vs yr ago.

text.p: Peru's tax revenues rose in August to 1.633 billion soles, 13.8 percent higher in nominal terms than the same month last year, the National Superintendency of Tax Administration (SUNAT) said Wednesday.
The SUNAT added that accumulated revenues for the first eight months were 13.341 billion soles, up 8.3 percent in real terms taking into account inflation.
Tax collection last year rose 27.7 percent nominally to 17.063 billion soles, from 13.363 billion soles in 1994.
Peru's consumer inflation was 11.77 percent in the last 12 months up to August.
